CatDescriptText: Mr. Johnny Walker, bricklayer helper, and 1854 Bedford Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 29, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that taverns should be permitted to remain open past midnight on Saturdays?" answer reads: "The time for tavern closing on Saturday should remain at 12 midnight. All the taverns do not obey the law and therefore it should be enforced."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Johnny Walker, wearing trench coat and hat with dark band, standing in front of Fanny Farmer Candies, with Raab clothing store and Dimlings candy store in background, Wood Street, Downtown
